data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you face forward or face reverse, you are facing the direction you started. To take a step backward, you should always face forward. The starting point is the position you are in right now. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you walk in four steps, turn around and walk back. The final answer: yes.

Take 4 steps. Back turn around take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 1 step towards the starting point, you will have to take 7 more steps in order to go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 10 steps, turn left again and take 9 steps, take 3 steps, take 3 steps, turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around. Take 7 steps around. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Take right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right at the beginning point and take 8 steps for the last step. Take 8 steps for the last step and get back to start where you started. So, the answer is Yes.

One never returns to the starting point while on a roll. Thus, the answer is no.

Face forward, take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 2 steps, you will take 2 steps in the direction you are walking in, but when you turn around you take 2 steps and the direction you are walking in is reversed so your destination is changed. The instructions say you begin with 9 steps, and you take 3 steps in the direction you are walking in, but when you turn around in the direction you are walking in you take 7 steps, and the direction you are walking in is reversed so you take 3 steps in the direction you are walking in. So, the answer is No.

In order to go backward, you have to step backward. To go back forward, you take 3 steps forward and take 1 step backward. So, the answer is yes.

There is a starting point which you must always always face forward. In addition, there are multiple directions in which you can move. So, the answer is No.

They all return to the starting point. If one was in the beginning, they would be facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

You would always take two steps right, right side of the starting point, and one step left. So, the answer is Yes.

The previous step is to continue facing right. The last step is to start facing left. If you see both directions, you return to the previous step. In order to return back to the beginning, you first need to face the same direction you had a while ago and you then want to make a return. So, the answer is Yes.

One turns and turns around. One takes 4 steps. One takes 10 steps. One takes 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Place your foot on the ground, and turn around to the right. In this sequence, you spend 2 steps at the direction you originally started the sequence. Taking 10 step forwards takes 10 steps back to the starting point. Take 1 step forwards takes 1 step forwards takes 1 step back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

To take 10 steps, you repeat the instructions. They all have different numbers that refer to the same point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is where you started. Taking 5 steps from the starting point takes you back to the starting point. Taking 10 steps towards the starting point will make you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Since each of these actions are given in numerical order, the first one needs to be followed. When the instructions say take 4 steps forward, that is 4 + 6 = 13.
